name: Calculus 1
description: An introduction to calculus with emphasis on concepts and principles. Topics studied include limits, derivatives, applications of derivatives, and antiderivatives.

name: Discrete Mathematics
description: Discrete mathematical structures (in contrast to continuous functions) are essential for many mathematical disciplines, including computer science.  This course provides a foundation for the study of such structures by introducing students to set theory, propositional logic, proofs, induction, relations, algorithms, number theory, and graph theory.

name: Calculus 2
description: A continuation of MATH 1903 including techniques and applications of integration, polar coordinates, and infinite series.

name: Cognate Elective Courses
description: Half of the required cognate courses must be Jr.-Sr. level.
